curriculum_stages.name: Basic Hit or Stand
curriculum_stages.description: Learn the fundamentals of Blackjack. The agent will only be able to hit or stand. Focus is on understanding when to take a card and when to stay based on the player's hand and the dealer's upcard. A simple rule based approach will be sufficient to get started.

curriculum_stages.name: Advanced Hit or Stand
curriculum_stages.description: Refine Hit/Stand decisions. The agent will continue learning when to take a card and when to stay, with greater complexity. This is the key stage where the agent needs to learn basic strategy, it has a larger number of samples to learn a more complex policy.

curriculum_stages.name: Adding Double Down
curriculum_stages.description: Introduce the Double Down action. The agent must now learn when it is advantageous to double its bet. Focus should be on identifying favorable situations based on the player's hand and the dealer's upcard (e.g., hard 11 vs. most dealer upcards).

curriculum_stages.name: Full Blackjack (Hit, Stand, Double, Split)
curriculum_stages.description: Full Blackjack game with all available actions. The agent now has access to all actions, including splitting pairs. The agent must learn to integrate splitting decisions into its overall strategy, considering the odds and potential payoffs of splitting different pairs against various dealer upcards. Requires a very good understanding of the underlying probabilities and complex strategy. The agent is expected to converge to optimal play.
